isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - OUTPUT SHAFT OIL SEAL

caution.para: To prevent oil leaks, do not touch the seal lip, and make sure the seal driver is clean.

step1.para: Place a seal on the oil seal driver, and drive the new seal into the rear bearing cover. The seal is fully installed when the flange on the seal is flush with the shoulder in the bore ( Figure 164).

figure.caption: Figure 164. Installing New Output Shaft Oil Seal

step1.para: Install a new slinger on the speedometer rotor/seal sleeve using a slinger driver ( Figure 165).
If previously removed, install the O-ring over the output shaft ( Figure 166).

caution.para: To avoid creating oil leaks, make sure the speedometer rotor/seal sleeve is free from contaminants.

step1.para: Install the speedometer rotor/seal sleeve over the output shaft, and install the speedometer sensors ( Figure 166).

figure.caption: Figure 166. Installing O-Ring And Speedometer Rotor/Seal Sleeve

step1.para: Install the output yoke over the output shaft. The yoke should slide on when the splines are lined up. If it does not, clean the splines with solvent, and oil them lightly.
Inspect the output shaft nut for damage and wear. If the nylon locking material is damaged or excessively worn, use a new output nut.

note.para: The nylon locking material must be in good condition so that nut does not loosen when the vehicle is in use.

step1.para: Lightly oil the output shaft threads and the output nut threads, and install the nut. Tighten the nut to 610 to 678 Nm (450 to 500 ft-lbs).
